1.text: Hear ye this word which I take up for a lamentation over you, O house of Israel:

2.text: The virgin of Israel is fallen, She shall no more rise; She is cast down upon her land, There is none to raise her up.

3.text: For thus saith the Lord GOD: The city that went forth a thousand shall have a hundred left, and that which went forth a hundred shall have ten left, of the house of Israel.

4.text: For thus saith the LORD unto the house of Israel: Seek ye Me, and live;

5.text: But seek not Beth-el, Nor enter into Gilgal, And pass not to Beer-sheba; For Gilgal shall surely go into captivity, And Beth-el shall come to nought.

6.text: Seek the LORD, and live—Lest He break out like fire in the house of Joseph, And it devour, and there be none to quench it in Bethel—

7.text: Ye who turn judgment to wormwood, And cast righteousness to the ground;

8.text: Him that maketh the Pleiades and Orion, And bringeth on the shadow of death in the morning, And darkeneth the day into night; That calleth for the waters of the sea, And poureth them out upon the face of the earth; The LORD is His name;

9.text: That causeth destruction to flash upon the strong, So that destruction cometh upon the fortress.

10.text: They hate him that reproveth in the gate, And they abhor him that speaketh uprightly.

11.text: Therefore, because ye trample upon the poor, And take from him exactions of wheat; Ye have built houses of hewn stone, But ye shall not dwell in them, Ye have planted pleasant vineyards, But ye shall not drink wine thereof.

12.text: For I know how manifold are your transgressions, And how mighty are your sins; Ye that afflict the just, that take a ransom, And that turn aside the needy in the gate.

13.text: Therefore the prudent doth keep silence in such a time; For it is an evil time.

14.text: Seek good, and not evil, that ye may live; And so the LORD, the God of hosts, will be with you, as ye say.

15.text: Hate the evil, and love the good, And establish justice in the gate; It may be that the LORD, the God of hosts, Will be gracious unto the remnant of Joseph.

16.text: Therefore thus saith the LORD, The God of hosts, the Lord: Lamentation shall be in all the broad places, And they shall say in all the streets: ‘Alas! alas!’ And they shall call the husbandman to mourning, And proclaim lamentation to such as are skilful of wailing.

17.text: And in all vineyards shall be lamentation; For I will pass through the midst of thee, Saith the LORD.

18.text: Woe unto you that desire the day of the LORD! Wherefore would ye have the day of the LORD? It is darkness, and not light.

19.text: As if a man did flee from a lion, And a bear met him; And went into the house and leaned his hand on the wall, And a serpent bit him.

20.text: Shall not the day of the LORD be darkness, and not light? Even very dark, and no brightness in it?

21.text: I hate, I despise your feasts, And I will take no delight in your solemn assemblies.

22.text: Yea, though ye offer me burnt-offerings and your meal-offerings, I will not accept them; Neither will I regard the peace-offerings of your fat beasts.

23.text: Take thou away from Me the noise of thy songs; And let Me not hear the melody of thy psalteries.

24.text: But let justice well up as waters, And righteousness as a mighty stream.

25.text: Did ye bring unto Me sacrifices and offerings in the wilderness forty years, O house of Israel?

26.text: So shall ye take up Siccuth your king and Chiun your images, the star of your god, which ye made to yourselves.

27.text: Therefore will I cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus, saith He, whose name is the LORD God of hosts.
